explanation.rules:
The reduplication (R) is formed from the stressed syllable, C1VC2, where V is the stressed vowel.
North dialect. The reduplicated form R is C1VC2, with the following exceptions:
If C1 = C2, the form is C1V.
If a vowel comes before C1, the form is C2.
Coast dialect. The reduplicated form R is C1V1C2V2, with the following exceptions:
If there is no V2, the form is C1V1C2.
If there is no V2 and C2 is one of the set {C1, k, g, ŋ, w}, the form is C1V1.
(C1, C2 are consonants; V, V1, V2 are vowels).
